starting_post.message:
01:14:542 - From here i think it's rather notcieable that the sound gets gradually amplified, so probably some pattern changes can be implemented to reflect that better, a simple way i get is to just start with some jacks, e.g.

![](https://osu.ppy.sh/ss/19382843/0373)

it would be harder by quite a bit tho, so feel free to reject if you think it too hard or you prefer other ways, and for lower diffs i think it can be changed slightly too but just no need to contrast that much

od 5.5 is enough for this bpm and note density

starting_post.message:
after all I really would like to see more sv changes in this map, especially around 01:07:792 02:23:992 04:40:792,

since there are several instances of sections with constant sv changes it feels rather odd to play when there are others with static velocity,

some suggestions include but are not limited to:

(1) gradual decrease from 01:07:792 to 01:11:992 and similars during this kiai 
01:12:592 to 01:16:792 
01:17:392 to 01:21:592
01:22:192 to 01:26:092
and a long one for the long stream, 01:26:542 to 01:35:242 
the values up to you but I recommend using a higher one for the longer streams

(2) 02:23:992 02:28:792 02:34:192 02:38:392 all of these sections are x0.50 static, I think all instances should have different sv value to contrast the difference between these 4 parts of the drop,
could also add gradual decrease at 02:23:992 (222,223,224,225,226,227,228) - 

(3) for this slow jam consider 04:09:892 decrease sv till 04:14:392 then increase till 04:16:642 for a more dynamic looking section

(4) similar to the first point, the last kiai could include an sv decrease 04:40:792 to 04:47:392, also 04:48:142 and 04:50:392sound particularly unique so both could include sv increases instead
02:49:835 could manual break here
